text_blocks.text: Hi there! I’m Miti Karia and I’ll tell you a bit about me before diving into the folio. Two years ago, I started
out as a senior copywriter in a well-known startup in India (where I come from) and discovered a love for
shaping the “why” behind the message, which sparked my shift towards creative strategy. Later, I moved to
London to pursue Master's in Strategic Advertising and Marketing Communications. And this portfolio is the
representation of my journey so far.

to B2C, while training in strategy.

strategic thinking skills under expert mentorship.

, we often struggle to adapt to new
environments while longing for familiarity, leading to a
creating spaces where everyone feels at
To position Pangea Café as a
The brief is to create an
for Pangea Café, a diverse coffee shop
with global ingredients and an immigrant owner, to counter the rising hate and division in
the UK. The campaign aims to spread the message that racism has no place here while
celebrating the café's multicultural roots and unity through coffee.
To position Pangea Cafe as a symbol of unity and inclusivity, using
coffee to celebrate diversity and counter racism.
Socially conscious coffee lovers who are and value diversity and
seek meaningful experiences in their daily rituals.
shops and are active on social
coffee as a tool to break
people, one cup at a time?
If coffee could talk, it would tell racists to take a hike. But coffee doesn’t
talk—it connects people, one cup at a time. At Pangea Café, we’ve created
a rich blend of flavours, cultures, and stories, proving that diversity isn’t
just an ideal—it’s the essence of what we serve. Coffee is more than a drink
—it’s a bridge to connection and belonging.
At Pangea, every cup tells a story.
It’s more than a campaign — it's a movement!
Because at Pangea, we don’t just brew coffee. We brew connection. And if
you don’t like that, well… there’s always instant.
From the background research and insights, we’ve identified
The campaign stays vibrant with weekly Brewing Tales: Blend &
Bond sessions—open-mic nights featuring stories of global
unity paired with speciality coffee tastings, shared online to
An Instagram series, Archie Says No to Racists, sees our cheeky
mascot delivering witty anti-hate messages like, “I sniff
everything—racism smells the worst.” Alongside this,
Community Spotlights celebrate customers and staff, sharing
their cultural stories and love for Pangea.
The Unity Wall invites customers to pin their origins and share
messages countering hate under the statement, “Hate Ends With
The Unity Brew Flat White Supremacist (JK, It’s Just Coffee)—a
striking iced coffee with beans from three continents—symbolizes
diversity with the tagline, "Proof that just white isn’t supreme—
blend it with the world," driving conversation and buzz.
In-café initiatives like the Passport to Unity loyalty card reward
customers with stamps from diverse coffee origins, turning every
sip into a celebration of inclusion.
Pop-up Coffee for Connection stalls in public spaces pairs
strangers for meaningful conversations over free coffee.
Moments are captured as Instagram reels, showcasing unity
brewed one cup at a time.
The campaign begins with a subtle, curiosity-driven rollout across
On social media, cryptic Instagram Reels and carousels tease glimpses of
blurred or fragmented campaign posters with captions like, “Can a cup
of coffee break barriers?” and “This brew’s got a story. Guess what it is.”
Striking posters in public spaces—on transport, sidewalks, café tables,
and takeaway cup sleeves—hint at something extraordinary brewing at
Inside the café, a partially constructed Unity Wall invites intrigue and
encourages participation. This layered teasing approach builds buzz
while leaving just enough mystery to spark anticipation for the reveal.

With NDSA, it’s not just about
offers expert-led training and tools for inclusive

Our mission is to empower neurodivergent individuals in the
workplace, providing tailored support and guidance. We offer
comprehensive coaching, advocacy, and a national forum
where neurodivergent adults can express their needs,

, I responded to a creative brief by @OneMinuteBriefs on X
(Twitter), crafting a quick and impactful idea to promote cycling to work, i was in the top 5
winners. The challenge aligns with Transport for London's mission to encourage
sustainable commuting options across the city.
- By One Minute Briefs (OMG) on X
Promote #CycleToWorkDay by showcasing the cost-saving and eco-friendly benefits of cycling.
Cycling saves money while supporting a healthier and greener London.
Use the London Eye as a visual metaphor to link cycling with sustainability and savings.
- By One Minute Briefs (OMG) on X
I participated in a creative brief by
@OneMinuteBriefs on X (Twitter), crafting posters that reimagine famous Manchester-
based artist/band song lyrics to promote the platform’s home service categories. The
campaign leverages TaskRabbit’s quick, reliable solutions to everyday tasks.
Drive awareness of TaskRabbit’s ability to deliver rapid, dependable home repair services
while engaging audiences with creative, localized messaging.
People are more likely to act on home repair needs when the solution feels effortless and
Leverage culturally iconic music references and lighthearted humor to create a
memorable association with TaskRabbit’s swift and reliable services.
